intro: Astroloma drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in shrublands and open woodlands. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Astroloma drummondii is well adapted to arid conditions and is considered a valuable component of local ecosystems.
